title: Rotation Behavior Dependent on Robot Orientation

content.raw:
It appears the angular rotation rate of the X1 \(haven’t tested it on the X2\), is at least partially dependent on the orientation of the robot. I noticed it initially while manually driving the robot around, and confirmed it by running some tests. My test setup is simple, do nothing when the controller is launched except post constant angular velocities to /X1/cmd\_vel, while printing out the z-axis angle of the robot \(it’s initial facing as 0\) and ROS time in elapsed seconds. I then analyzed the output data and the results are as follows:

‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2843748222-image.png)
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3451061457-image.png)
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/775762207-cmdvel.png)
